cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (70 km) NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift SE this morning, turn N-NE and then due N through the central Gulf of Mexico, aiming toward the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the mouth of the Mississippi River / Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning currently limited to the Mexican coast – Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch ‑ Mexican coast only at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle, with highest risk along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible across Plaquemines Parish late Saturday night into Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–5 ft above ground along open coast and tidal waterways of Plaquemines Parish including the port facilities
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall with isolated higher amounts possible Sunday into Monday, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous marine conditions, possible tornadoes in outer rainbands, and coastal erosion that may affect port access channels
